file_content.text: Thank you for the help, but Watcher Eight wants me to continue recon from this position. You shouldn't stay here.
I've got my mission, you've got yours. Find Watcher Eight when you have the code cylinders.
Go--no, wait, Watcher Eight alerted me about you. My mission's been compromised, and I need your help.
I need to gather clearance code cylinders from Republic officials around the landing field. Sadly, prying the cylinders from their bodies will be necessary.
I've already identified the targets; I need you to handle them and take the code cylinders back to Watcher Eight.
I assume you won't just be sitting here while someone else does your job.
What will you be doing?
I'll be finishing my recon mission for Watcher Eight, which is... classified. You understand.
I'd welcome the challenge.
They won't get away with the trouble they've caused me, either.
Don't bark orders at me.
I apologize, but those code cylinders are vital, and you're far more combat-ready than I am.
When you have the cylinders, plant some explosive charges on the ships on the ground. I need a distraction for the critical stage of my recon.
I'd prefer a more elegant solution.
A rather crude approach.
I thought Imperial Intelligence was more... circumspect than that.
Not very subtle.
The time for elegance is long gone.
Leave it to me.
Explosions? Sounds good.
These should be enough charges. I know Watcher Eight trusted your skills--but be careful.
What are you doing? Get away before my cover's blown!
